intro: Oreocharis wangwentsaii var. wangwentsaii, commonly known as the Wangwentsai oreocharis, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, often fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions with cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while its inflorescence consists of a few showy blooms. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
